section.section: The Advisory Council consists of 11 voting members and 5 nonvoting members.

Of the 11 voting members:
1 shall be a member of the Senate appointed by the President of the Senate;
1 shall be a member of the House of Delegates appointed by the Speaker of the House;
4 shall be professional individuals in the field of hereditary or congenital disorders appointed by the Governor; and
5 shall be individuals appointed by the Governor, none of whom may be:
A health professional or spouse of a health professional; or
An individual or spouse of an individual involved in the administration or ownership of any health care institution or health insurance organization.
The number of names on a list shall be 3.

An organization shall submit its list:
At least 3 months before the expiration of the term of the professional member who represents the organization; and
If a vacancy is for a reason other than expiration of the term, at any time before the Governor makes the appointment, if the organization complies with the reasonable request of the Governor for the list.

If a list is not submitted to the Governor as required under subparagraph (iii) of this paragraph, within 3 months after a request is made by the Governor, the Governor may appoint any professional individual who meets the requirements under subsection (b) of this section.

Of the 5 nonvoting members:
1 shall be a representative of the State Health Planning and Development Agency, appointed by the Secretary; and
4 shall be representatives of the Department, appointed by the Secretary.

text.section: Each professional individual selected for the Advisory Council shall be knowledgeable in the diagnosis and treatment of hereditary and congenital disorders.

section.section: The term of a voting member is 4 years.
At the end of a term, a voting member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A voting member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A voting member who serves 2 consecutive full 4-year terms may not be reappointed for 4 years after completion of those terms.
When a vacancy occurs, a successor shall be appointed promptly.
